snippet: In a tricky juggling act, New York City relies primarily on a fleet of box trucks to remove bikes from stations that are full and refill those that are running low.
abstract: New York City's bike share system is locked in a perpetual raced against its riders to remove bikes from fully occupied stations and to refill stations where supply is running dry; city relies primarily on fleet of box trucks to shift bikes, and has leased three spaces as staging areas for bikes that can be brought to nearby stations that tend to empty quickly.
lead_paragraph: In a tricky juggling act, New York City relies primarily on a fleet of box trucks to remove bikes from stations that are full and refill those that are running low.

headline.main: The Balancing Act That Bike-Share Riders Just Watch
headline.print_headline: The Balancing Act That Bike-Share Riders Just Watch
